title: Geography Education Competency Enhancement Program Through Spatial Problem-Based Flipped Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic geography concepts at the secondary education level and experience with digital tools
context.additional_context: Participation by in-service secondary teachers and educational practitioners focusing on geography education methodologies and spatial cognition development

learning_goals: Learners can solve three real-world contextual geography tasks by applying the Spatial Problem-Based Learning (SPBL) framework.
In a flipped classroom learning (FCL) environment, learners can develop and execute self-directed learning plans using digital geography content (maps, GIS, etc.).
Learners can write spatial problem-solving reports based on case analysis using spatial reasoning and visualization skills.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
